bibl.title: Petitioner v. Defendant. Type of document
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: Territory of Washington County of nez perce Terry Judicial District | ss.
To the United States District Court of the first Judicial Dist Oct Ten 1863
C E Irvine vs Gillman & Heart

The above named Plff complains of the above named defts to and that on or about the 18th day of Feb 1862 said Plff sold to the above written Defts Three head of horse for the sum of one hundred and twenty dollars That said defts have neglected to pay the sid sum or any part Thereof though frequently requests to do so whereupon Plff prays Judgment against said Defts for the sum of one hundred and twenty dollars Laeful intent and cost of suit.
CE Irvine being duly sworn says that he has heard of the foregoing and knowing the same to be true of his own knowledge
Dated Sept 8th 1862 Sworn to and subscribed before me the 8th day of September 1862
Gilman Heayes district Clerk for Shoshoue

I hearby certify that I served the within complaint on the defendant Gillman xmotherx by delievering a correct & certified copy of the complaint & affidavit & notice now in my hands for service in the command of appearance W.T. on the 10th day of Sept. AD, 1862
div1.ab: Sanford, Owens Sheriff of Nez Perece County W.T. By J.N. Crabb Dept for said county of W.T.
div1.p: Gilman Hayes district clerk for Shoshoue
C.E. Irvine v.s. Gillman & Heart District Court
Filed October Sept 30 1862 Gilman Hayes Clerk.
